author: RobertoRojas
body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

Hello everyone, I'm working with PWSH, the idea in general is have a ps1 file with the definition of several scriptblocks and select one (to have control of the version to execute). To get the block I'm using the function Write-Output to return it. But it throw a weir error. 

This problem only happen with the ScriptBlock, I checked the expected object of Write-Output:

Write-Output [-InputObject] <psobject> [-NoEnumerate] [<CommonParameters>]

@{}.GetType() -> System.Object
{}.GetType() -> System.Object

Is possible write a hashtable, and the both are System.Object.

Obviously, you can have different workarounds:

```powershell
Invoke-Command -ScriptBlock $([Scriptblock]::Create((Write-Output -InputObject {Write-Host 'Hello block!'}.ToString())));
```

```powershell
Invoke-Command -ScriptBlock $(Write-Output -InputObject $([psobject]@{"Command"={Write-Host 'Hello block!'}})).Command
```

### Expected behavior

```console
PS> Write-Output -InputObject {write-host 'Hello world!'}
write-host 'Hello world!'
```


### Actual behavior

```console
PS> Write-Output -InputObject {write-host 'Hello world!'}
Write-Output: Cannot evaluate parameter 'InputObject' because its argument is specified as a script block and there is no input. A script block cannot be evaluated without input.
```


### Error details

```console
Write-Output: Cannot evaluate parameter 'InputObject' because its argument is specified as a script block and there is no input. A script block cannot be evaluated without input.
```


### Environment data

```powershell
PS> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.2.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.2.0
OS                             Linux 5.14.18-100.fc33.x86_64 #1 SMP Fri Nov 12 17:38:44 UTC 2021
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```


### Visuals

_No response_

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Please reword your OP. Can you use an translator (google, deepl) to get more clear English? Please add more clear repro steps.

title: Write-Output cannot get as an inputobject a ScriptBlock
